ETYMOLOGY: From Middle English bifore, from Old English beforan ('in front of, ahead of, in the presence of, sooner than'), a compound of be- (by) + foran (in front).

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: preposition (used before a noun, pronoun, or phrase to show place, time, or direction)
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: Earlier than (a particular time, event, or person).
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: Please submit your application before the deadline.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 请在截止日期前提交你的申请。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: adverb (modifies a verb, adjective, or other adverb)
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: I have heard that story before.

MEANINGS.DEF_EN: Up to the time that; prior to the time when the action in the dependent clause takes place.
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: You must check the oil before you start the car.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 你必须在启动汽车前检查机油。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: preposition (used before a noun, pronoun, or phrase to show place, time, or direction)
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: In front of, or in the presence of (especially in a formal or legal setting).
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 在……前面；当着……的面（尤指正式或法律场合）。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: The case will be heard before a jury.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 该案件将由陪审团审理。
